analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased a little across the UK over the last five years. The -4.2% change compared to a change of -2.6% in all A-Level entries over the last five years.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in art and design subjects in 2018 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 27.7% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in art and design subjects compared to 26.4% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have decreased a little across the UK over the last five years. The -0.4% change compared to a change of -2.6% in all A-Level entries over the last five years.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in biology in 2018 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 25.9% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in biology compared to 26.4% for all subjects.

Entries in business studies have increased sharply across the UK over the last five years. The 22.9% change compared to a change of -2.6% in all A-Level entries over the last five years.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved the top grades in business studies in 2018 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 15.2% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in business studies compared to 26.4% for all subjects.

Entries in chemistry have increased a little across the UK over the last five years. The 1.2% change compared to a change of -2.6% in all A-Level entries over the last five years.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved the top grades in chemistry in 2018 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 31.1% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in chemistry compared to 26.4% for all subjects.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved the top grades in classical subjects in 2018 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 35.3% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in classical subjects compared to 26.4% for all subjects.
